snippet.textDisplay: Both Moderna and Pfizer, whose vaccines use an mRNA platform, found their vaccines to be about 95% effective. The AstraZeneca/Oxford vaccine showed a somewhat lower efficacy, but is less expensive and poses fewer issues involved in distribution and administration. 👍
snippet.textOriginal: Both Moderna and Pfizer, whose vaccines use an mRNA platform, found their vaccines to be about 95% effective. The AstraZeneca/Oxford vaccine showed a somewhat lower efficacy, but is less expensive and poses fewer issues involved in distribution and administration. 👍

snippet.textDisplay: So they investigated their own vaccines? Likely should been proven effective by a neutral 3rd party.

snippet.textDisplay: The AstraZeneca efficacy was based on not being affected; the other two on not showing symptoms - which is the case in 20% of people with the infection, I think? The difference is that someone who is asymptomatic can still be contagious
